page.title: 08Local Government
page.content: Each village has its own parish Council and is within Suffolk Coastl District council, which is in turn within Suffolk County Council. The Parish Council is elected every three years, with by-elections is necessary, and is able to levy a small rate to cover street lighting and local amenities. Their council meetings are open to the public to attend but few bother to do so. Parish noticeboards are placed in strategic positions. In Playford and Bealings the respectie parish councils manage their village halls, and the latter a children's playground. Rush-mere has landscaped a pond with seats nearby as a leisure area. The primary school is administered by the County Council. The nearest DHSS office is in Ipswich, the Job Centre for the area in woodbridge.
